title: Requires colleges to provide students and employees information on security policies and incidents of crime and negligence on campus
summary: Requires state university security officers to provide students and employees with information on security policies and incidents of crime and negligence committed upon any student or person on the campus or other college property; requires publication on an annual basis a report including statistics reflecting incidents of actual and alleged crime on campus for the most recent three year period.

       AN ACT to amend the education law, in relation to requiring institutions
         of higher education to provide to students and  employees  information
         relating  to  security  policies, security procedures and incidents of
         crime on campus

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  Section  6430 of the education law is amended by adding a
    2  new subdivision 1-a to read as follows:
    3    1-A. (A) PURSUANT TO THE REQUIREMENTS SET FORTH IN SUBDIVISION ONE  OF
    4  THIS  SECTION, SUCH INSTITUTIONS SHALL ALSO PUBLISH ON AN ANNUAL BASIS A
    5  REPORT WHICH SHALL INCLUDE STATISTICS REFLECTING INCIDENTS OF ACTUAL AND
    6  ALLEGED CRIME ON CAMPUS FOR THE MOST RECENT THREE YEAR PERIOD.
    7    (B) EACH INSTITUTION OF HIGHER EDUCATION  SHALL,  IN  ITS  APPLICATION
    8  FORMS  FOR ADMISSION AND FOR EMPLOYMENT, NOTIFY EACH POTENTIAL APPLICANT
    9  THAT INFORMATION REGARDING THE INSTITUTION'S SECURITY POLICIES, SECURITY
   10  PROCEDURES AND A STATISTICAL LISTING OF ALL INCIDENTS RESULTING IN BODI-
   11  LY INJURY, PROPERTY DAMAGE, AND PROPERTY THEFT SHALL BE  MADE  AVAILABLE
   12  UPON  REQUEST.  INSTITUTIONS  WITH  A MAIN CAMPUS AND ONE OR MORE BRANCH
   13  CAMPUSES SHALL PROVIDE THE INFORMATION ON A CAMPUS-BY-CAMPUS BASIS. SUCH
   14  INFORMATION FOR THE MOST RECENT SCHOOL YEAR SHALL INCLUDE,  BUT  NOT  BE
   15  LIMITED TO, THE FOLLOWING:
   16    (I) THE NUMBER OF UNDERGRADUATE AND GRADUATE STUDENTS ENROLLED;
   17    (II)  THE  NUMBER  OF  UNDERGRADUATE  AND  GRADUATE STUDENTS LIVING IN
   18  STUDENT HOUSING;
   19    (III) THE TOTAL NUMBER OF NON-STUDENT EMPLOYEES WORKING ON CAMPUS;
   20    (IV) THE ADMINISTRATIVE OFFICE RESPONSIBLE FOR SECURITY ON THE CAMPUS;
   21    (V) A DESCRIPTION  OF  THE  TYPE  AND  NUMBER  OF  SECURITY  PERSONNEL
   22  UTILIZED BY THE INSTITUTION, INCLUDING A DESCRIPTION OF THEIR TRAINING;

    1    (VI)  THE ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITY OF SECURITY PERSONNEL, INCLUDING THEIR
    2  WORKING RELATIONSHIP WITH THE STATE AND LOCAL POLICE AGENCIES;
    3    (VII)  POLICY  ON  REPORTING  CRIMINAL  INCIDENTS  TO  STATE AND LOCAL
    4  POLICE;
    5    (VIII)  POLICY  REGARDING  ACCESS  TO  INSTITUTIONAL  FACILITIES   AND
    6  PROGRAMS BY STUDENTS, EMPLOYEES, GUESTS AND OTHER INDIVIDUALS;
    7    (IX) PROCEDURES AND FACILITIES FOR STUDENTS AND OTHERS TO REPORT CRIM-
    8  INAL  ACTIONS  OR  OTHER  EMERGENCIES  OCCURRING  ON CAMPUS AND POLICIES
    9  CONCERNING THE INSTITUTION'S RESPONSE TO SUCH REPORTS;
   10    (X) A STATEMENT OF POLICY REGARDING THE POSSESSION, USE, AND  SALE  OF
   11  ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGES;
   12    (XI)  A STATEMENT OF POLICY REGARDING THE POSSESSION, USE, AND SALE OF
   13  ILLEGAL DRUGS;
   14    (XII) A STATEMENT OF POLICY REGARDING THE POSSESSION AND USE OF  WEAP-
   15  ONS BY SECURITY PERSONNEL AND ANY OTHER PERSON ON CAMPUS;
   16    (XIII)  ANY  POLICY  REGARDING  STUDENTS  OR  EMPLOYEES  WITH CRIMINAL
   17  RECORDS;
   18    (XIV) SECURITY CONSIDERATIONS USED IN THE MAINTENANCE OF CAMPUS FACIL-
   19  ITIES, INCLUDING LANDSCAPING, GROUNDSKEEPING, AND OUTDOOR LIGHTING;
   20    (XV) A DESCRIPTION OF THE COMMUNICATION MEDIUMS  USED  TO  INFORM  THE
   21  CAMPUS  COMMUNITY  ABOUT  SECURITY MATTERS AS WELL AS THE FREQUENCY WITH
   22  WHICH THE INFORMATION IS PROVIDED; AND
   23    (XVI) A STATISTICAL DESCRIPTION OF ALL THE DATA REPORTED TO THE  SECU-
   24  RITY  OFFICES WITHIN EACH INSTITUTION AS FOLLOWS: INCIDENTS RESULTING IN
   25  BODILY INJURY, PROPERTY DAMAGE, AND PROPERTY THEFT; INCIDENTS  INVOLVING
   26  SEX  OFFENSES,  SEXUAL  HARASSMENT,  OR ANY SEXUAL MISCONDUCT ON CAMPUS;
   27  INCIDENTS OF UNNATURAL DEATHS ON CAMPUS DUE TO ALLEGED  CRIMINAL  BEHAV-
   28  IOR,  ALLEGED  GROSS NEGLIGENCE OR ALLEGED NEGLIGENCE BY THE EDUCATIONAL
   29  INSTITUTION ITSELF; AND BIAS OR RACIALLY MOTIVATED INCIDENTS ON  CAMPUS.
   30  THIS  REPORT SHALL COMPRISE REPORTED INCIDENTS PERTAINING TO THE STUDENT
   31  BODY, AND THE EMPLOYEES AND THE FACULTY OF THAT INSTITUTION.
   32    (C) INSTITUTIONS  WHICH  MAINTAIN  STUDENT  HOUSING  FACILITIES  SHALL
   33  INCLUDE IN THE INFORMATION REQUIRED BY PARAGRAPH (B) OF THIS SUBDIVISION
   34  THE FOLLOWING:
   35    (I)  TYPES OF STUDENT HOUSING AVAILABLE (ON-CAMPUS, OFF-CAMPUS; SINGLE
   36  ROOM,  DOUBLE,  GROUP;  SINGLE  SEX,  CO-ED;  UNDERGRADUATE,   GRADUATE,
   37  MARRIED; ETC.);
   38    (II)  POLICIES  ON  HOUSING  ASSIGNMENTS  AND REQUESTS BY STUDENTS FOR
   39  ASSIGNMENT CHANGES;
   40    (III) POLICIES CONCERNING THE IDENTIFICATION AND ADMISSION OF VISITORS
   41  IN STUDENT HOUSING FACILITIES;
   42    (IV) MEASURES TO SECURE THE ENTRANCES TO STUDENT HOUSING FACILITIES;
   43    (V) STANDARD SECURITY FEATURES USED TO SECURE  DOORS  AND  WINDOWS  IN
   44  STUDENTS' ROOMS;
   45    (VI)  A  DESCRIPTION  OF  THE  TYPE AND NUMBER OF EMPLOYEES, INCLUDING
   46  SECURITY PERSONNEL, ASSIGNED TO THE  STUDENT  HOUSING  FACILITIES  WHICH
   47  SHALL INCLUDE A DESCRIPTION OF THEIR SECURITY TRAINING;
   48    (VII)  A  DESCRIPTION  OF  THE TYPE OF TRAINING REQUIRED FOR RESIDENCE
   49  FACULTY,  INCLUDING  RESIDENCE  DIRECTORS,  RESIDENCE  ASSISTANTS,   AND
   50  STUDENT ASSISTANTS. THE INSTITUTION MUST ALSO LIST THE STATISTICS OF THE
   51  NUMBER OF RESIDENCE FACULTY WHO ARE CERTIFIED IN FIRST AID;
   52    (VIII)  THE  TYPE AND FREQUENCY OF PROGRAMS DESIGNED TO INFORM STUDENT
   53  HOUSING RESIDENTS ABOUT HOUSING SECURITY AND ENFORCEMENT PROCEDURES;
   54    (IX) POLICY AND ANY SPECIAL SECURITY PROCEDURES FOR  HOUSING  STUDENTS
   55  DURING LOW-OCCUPANCY PERIODS SUCH AS HOLIDAYS AND VACATION PERIODS; AND

    1    (X)  POLICY  ON  THE  HOUSING OF GUESTS AND OTHERS NOT ASSIGNED TO THE
    2  STUDENT HOUSING OR NOT REGULARLY  ASSOCIATED  WITH  THE  INSTITUTION  OF
    3  HIGHER EDUCATION.
    4    (D)  EACH INSTITUTION OF HIGHER EDUCATION SHALL PUBLISH AND DISTRIBUTE
    5  A REPORT WHICH SHALL BE UPDATED ANNUALLY AND  WHICH  SHALL  INCLUDE  THE
    6  SECURITY  POLICIES, SECURITY PROCEDURES, AND THE LISTING OF ALL RECORDED
    7  INCIDENTS AS REPORTED UNDER PARAGRAPH (B) OF THIS SUBDIVISION,  AND  THE
    8  INFORMATION  IN  SECURITY  POLICIES IN PARAGRAPH (C) OF THIS SUBDIVISION
    9  FOR THE MOST RECENT THREE YEAR PERIOD. THE INCIDENT RATES REPORTED UNDER
   10  THESE TWO PARAGRAPHS SHALL BE BASED ON THE NUMBER  OF  FULL-TIME  EQUIV-
   11  ALENT  UNDERGRADUATE  AND  GRADUATE  STUDENTS  AND  FULL-TIME EQUIVALENT
   12  EMPLOYEES AT THE INSTITUTION OF HIGHER EDUCATION.  LOCATIONS  SEPARATELY
   13  IDENTIFIABLE  FROM THE MAIN CAMPUS OF THE PARENT INSTITUTION AND PROVID-
   14  ING THE SERVICES NORMALLY ASSOCIATED  WITH  THE  CAMPUS  SHALL  ALSO  BE
   15  INCLUDED  IN  THESE FINDINGS. THE INSTITUTION SHALL PROVIDE UPON REQUEST
   16  THIS REPORT TO EVERY PERSON WHO REQUESTS SUCH INFORMATION  AND  TO  EACH
   17  NEW  EMPLOYEE  AT  THE TIME OF EMPLOYMENT. THE INFORMATION SHALL ALSO BE
   18  PROVIDED ON AN ANNUAL BASIS TO ALL STUDENTS AND EMPLOYEES.  INSTITUTIONS
   19  WITH MORE THAN ONE CAMPUS SHALL PROVIDE THE REQUIRED  INFORMATION  ON  A
   20  CAMPUS-BY-CAMPUS BASIS.
   21    EACH  AND  EVERY  INSTITUTION  OF  HIGHER  EDUCATION IN NEW YORK STATE
   22  SHALL, AFTER NOTIFICATION TO THE PUBLIC SAFETY OR CAMPUS SECURITY OFFICE
   23  AND WITHIN FORTY-EIGHT HOURS OF SUCH OFFICE'S CONCLUDING THAT  THERE  IS
   24  PROBABLE  CAUSE  TO BELIEVE THAT A CRIME OCCURRED, REPORT THE FOLLOWING:
   25  ALL CRIMES OR ALLEGED CRIMES INVOLVING AN ASSAULT AS DEFINED IN  ARTICLE
   26  ONE  HUNDRED  TWENTY  OF THE PENAL LAW, A HOMICIDE OR RELATED OFFENSE AS
   27  DEFINED IN ARTICLE ONE HUNDRED TWENTY-FIVE  OF  THE  PENAL  LAW,  A  SEX
   28  OFFENSE  AS  DEFINED  IN  ARTICLE ONE HUNDRED THIRTY OF THE PENAL LAW, A
   29  ROBBERY AS DEFINED IN ARTICLE ONE HUNDRED SIXTY OF  THE  PENAL  LAW,  OR
   30  INCIDENTS  INVOLVING  BODILY  INJURY  OR UNNATURAL DEATHS DUE TO ALLEGED
   31  CRIMINAL BEHAVIOR. THE OCCURRENCE OF SUCH INCIDENTS OR ALLEGED INCIDENTS
   32  SHALL BE ANNOUNCED IN ALL CAMPUS RESIDENTIAL HOUSING, CAMPUS  NEWSPAPERS
   33  AND  NOTICES  SHALL  BE CONSPICUOUSLY POSTED IN EACH BUILDING ON CAMPUS.
   34  SUCH ANNOUNCEMENTS SHALL INCLUDE THE TIME, LOCATION AND  NATURE  OF  THE
   35  CRIME  OR  ALLEGED  CRIME  AND THE DATE THE INCIDENT OR ALLEGED INCIDENT
   36  OCCURRED.
   37    S 2. This act shall  take  effect  on  the  first  of  September  next
   38  succeeding the date on which it shall have become a law.
